column5: Wow, those are just some incredible speciemens!!!
WWWOOOOOWWW!!!
That's AWESOME Aaron!
That river really produces some nice trout , way to go Aaron !
Insane. Wow those are some huge fish. Very nice job to all.
Those fish are awesome!  Good going!
great day on the lower Aaron congrats
That sucks, only one eater.   lol.  Just an awsome display of trouts!   Thanks for the wicked porn!

Always impressive to read your report , those size fish are also exceptional.  Care to share your set up? Lead weight size for bottom bouncing? Aside from roe, any other artificial you tried? Saw some crankbait behind some picture, can they go that deep?
Great report ! Those are some nice fish as well.
Fantastic report and beautiful pictures! Thanks for sharing!
Love it  man! Drifting for steel this time of year is so much fun! Great fish Aaron  TDunn

lol awesome man!

Right on.....  The usual for us Aaron, "A day late and a dollar short". Only this time we were a day early. Water just started to clear late in the day Friday. Coulda woulda shoulda......  Cheers, Ron...
Sweet fish....I love the niagara
Great Aaron. Txs for this report.
Those are some sweet specimens.....thanks for sharing
Wicked pics of wicked fish, looks like a total blast!! Thanks for sharing!
nice pictures some big hogs thanks for the report

Bass fighter, we employ a Three-way rig to bottom bounce with the bottom current. Boat control with Minn Kota is important to keep a slightly vertical presentation. I use 10lb main line on a spinning reel to a small black Three-way swivel. A dropper line same # approximately 10" to a pencil weight or slinky weight. I prefer slinky between just under 1/2 ounce to 3/4oz. I then tie a 4- to 8lb fluorocarbon leader (4- to 9 feet long) on to a black gammy octopus hook size 8 or 6. I then add either roe, skein, yarn, corky, TriggerX single egg, emerald shiner, TriggerX minnow 3" in white or something similar.  I also use Kwikfish, Hotshots, streamer flies, and have caught them on crankbaits. Pink worms between 3" and 8" are also good, as is orange worms. Casting hair jigs, spoons, spinners can work well, as can floating various baits as mentioned earlier. Jigs under Floats can also work well.  Good fishing!  Aaron
Thanks for all the nice coments everyone. Hopefully the conditions stay good!
Have always enjoyed viewing the great fishing Christine has done through her life.  Kudos to you Aaron for making that such a great day on the water.
